description: Create, update, or destroy Ansible Tower job templates. See U(https://www.ansible.com/tower) for an overview.

network_credential.description: The network_credential to use for the job_template.

ask_inventory.description: Propmt user for inventory on launch.

job_type.description: The job_type to use for the job_template.

ask_job_type.description: Prompt user for job type on launch.

host_config_key.description: Allow provisioning callbacks using this host config key.

skip_tags.description: The skip_tags to use for the job_template.

playbook.description: Playbook to use for the job_template.

job_tags.description: The job_tags to use for the job_template.

inventory.description: Inventory to use for the job_template.

limit.description: A host pattern to further constrain the list of hosts managed or affected by the playbook

forks.description: The number of parallel or simultaneous processes to use while executing the playbook.

cloud_credential.description: Cloud_credential to use for the job_template.

description.description: Description to use for the job_template.

tower_config_file.description: Path to the Tower config file. See notes.

machine_credential.description: Machine_credential to use for the job_template.

ask_credential.description: Prompt user for credential on launch.

name.description: Name to use for the job_template.

verbosity.description: Control the output level Ansible produces as the playbook runs.

project.description: Project to use for the job_template.

ask_extra_vars.description: Prompt user for extra_vars on launch.

extra_vars_path.description: Path to the extra_vars yaml file.

ask_tags.description: Prompt user for job tags on launch.

tower_verify_ssl.description: Dis/allow insecure connections to Tower. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
